org.jcatapult.security
Class JCEPasswordEncryptor

java.lang.Object
  org.jcatapult.security.JCEPasswordEncryptor
All Implemented Interfaces:
PasswordEncryptor<Object>
public class JCEPasswordEncryptor
extends Object
implements PasswordEncryptor<Object>

This class uses the JCE (Java Cryptography Extensions) to encode passwords. This encryption uses a salt source that is retrieved using the SaltSource interface.

This class uses the Apache commons configuration API to configure how the passwords are encrypted and encoded. The configuration values are:

NameDescriptionDefault
jcatapult.security.passwordEncryptor.encodeBase64Determines if the passwords are encoded into base 64 before they are returned.true
jcatapult.security.passwordEncryptor.algorithmThe encryption algorithm to use. This must be a JCE message digest algorithm.MD5

Method Detail

encryptPassword

public String encryptPassword(String password,
                              Object obj)
Encodes the rawPass using a MessageDigest. If a salt is specified it will be merged with the password before encoding.

Specified by:
encryptPassword in interface PasswordEncryptor<Object>
Parameters:
password - The plain text password.
obj - If this is not null, it is passed to the salt source. Otherwise, the default salt from the salt source is used.
Returns:
Hex string of password digest (or base64 encoded string if encodeHashAsBase64 is enabled).

encryptPassword

public String encryptPassword(String password)
Calls encryptPassword(String, Object).

Specified by:
encryptPassword in interface PasswordEncryptor<Object>
Parameters:
password - The password to encrypt.
Returns:
The encrypted password.

getMessageDigest

protected final MessageDigest getMessageDigest()
                                        throws IllegalArgumentException
Get a MessageDigest instance for the given algorithm.

Returns:
The MessageDigest instance.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the algorithm configured is not valid.

mergePasswordAndSalt

protected String mergePasswordAndSalt(String password,
                                      Object salt,
                                      boolean strict)

Merges the password and the salt. If the salt is null, this returns just the password. The format this uses if the salt is not null is password{salt}.

Parameters:
password - (Optional) The password to be used.
salt - (Optional) The salt to be used.
strict - (Optional) Determines if the salt can contain '{' or '}'.
Returns:
The merged result.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - If the salt contains '{' or '}'.
